Soaring across the dimly lit ocean in the pre-dawn hours, we find ourselves coming upon a certain island.

This... is Berk.

It's a few days North of a breath of sanity and cold enough to drop the balls off a yak. In the summer. Getting through the cold is just another pastime here.

The village is, in a word: sturdy. Been here for 300 years and every house is new. The only real problems are the pests. You see, while most places have mosquitoes or the occasional rat infestation, here there be -

A roar echoes through the air as a burst of molten flame soars into the slammed door of a house.

"Dragons." gasped a weary voice on edge.

The speaker is a scrawny auburn brunet teen wearing a long-sleeved green tunic with a bearskin vest over top. Seeing his house starting to smoulder and burn, he pulls open the door again to leave before the smoke gets to him.

This is Hiccup. Yeah, pretty great name, isn't it? Tradition says that a bad name wards off bad omens like trolls and goblins. Sadly, it probably does the same for good omens like attractive bonney lasses. (Like the cheerful Viking demeanor doesn't mess that up?)

Hiccup scrambles through the dawning chaos that is the dragon raid, holding back any smart remarks from the adults demanding that he go back inside, because... well it's a little bit ON FIRE, ya know? He's suddenly grabbed by the largest of the Vikings, Stoick the Vast.

"Hiccup? What is he doing out here?!" he yells out to the chaos before growling out, "What are YOU doing out here?! Get inside!" Tossing the boy not-so-gently away from a descending dragon. Hiccup didn't say much about this, being used to it. He heads over to the smithy to see a colorful handi-capable fellow.

"Ah, good to see you made it to the party, lad. Would have thought those beasties have flown off with ye." the stocky old viking with the braided handlebar mustache, peg leg, and interchanging left hand jibed at him.

Hiccup could only smirk at his mentor. "What? Come on, Gobber, you think they could handle all of this?" Hiccup made a flexing pose after putting on his leather apron.

The aforementioned meathead looked deadpan at him. "Well, they need toothpicks too, don't they?"

Hiccup just rolled his eyes and started working the bellows of the furnace. His eyes caught an explosion outside and looking out he could see several other teens going to put put out the fire. He saw Fishlegs, his cousin Snotlout, the twins Ruffnut and Tuffnut, and - Astrid.

He felt his blood drain from his brain down south as he looked at her strong slender frame and panicked for an instant before reaching into his vest and grabbing a small pouch before ingesting its contents, restoring his proper blood flow.

You see, unknown to all but three of the village - Hiccup himself, Gobber, and the elder Gothi - the so-called runt of Berk could wield quite the weapon no one else had: his dick was a mighty club over an ell at least in length (1 ell = approx.19 3/4 inches) hard with two swollen testes the size of large mace heads. YES I HIT IT!" he began to dance about in elation. "Ohoho did anyone see that?!" He joy was short-lived as he saw the red Monstrous Nightmare flame up in front of him. "Someone that could appreciate that... not you."

And with that, the chase was on!

Hiccup bolted through the village, and the Nightmare following in wanton destruction that the scrawny boy would no doubt be blamed for. He hid behind a brazier post while the dragon spewed its flame, and the beast stalked around it, only for Stoick to latch onto the Nightmare and wrestle it into submission.

The sun started rising, and the dragons carried off their spoils, and the brazier post snapped, falling off the cliffside, rolling into a net trapping a group of Nadders, and Hiccup left exposed (while still clothed) to Stoick's gaze.

"Hey dad..." he muttered, Stoick's scowl boring into him as the fires smouldered throughout Berk. "Okay, but I hit a Night Fury -!"

After being told off by his father, Gobber was taking him back home, passing by the teens again, Hiccup had to take another dose of herbs, even as Astrid glared at him.

"He never listens." Hiccup muttered.

"Runs in the family." Gobber stated as clear as the sunrise on the water.

"And - and it's not like I don't try, it's just he always gives that disappointed scowl, like someone skimped the meat on his sandwich." Hiccup stood straighter and puffed out his chest. "Excuse me, barmaid, I believe you have brought me the wrong offspring. I ordered an boy with beefy arms, extra guts and glory on the side. This here? This Is A TALKING FISHBONE!"

"Now, now." Gobber relented, "It's not yer outside that riles him up, it's what's inside he can't stand."

Hiccup just stared. "...Thank you for summing that up."

"You're welcome. Now stay put and try to not get into trouble." Gobber pulled him in close. "If you can, I might jus' be able to get you with some of the boys for a fun trip to the Bog Burglars' Isle. How's that sound?"

Hiccup rolled his eyes with a smile. The Bog Burglars were another Island tribe like those on Berk, the Hairy Hooligans. In contrast, the Bog Burglars were an all-female tribe, known for their own wily ways. Gobber had been giving that promise for a while now, but Hiccup always got into some sort of trouble, breaking the deal. "I'll think about it Gobber, thanks. I'll need to go see Gothi later anyway."

"Keh," Gobber scoffed. "Already run out?"

Hiccup only smiled at the old viking before entering his home.

- and slipping out the charred back of the house to Raven's Point.
